alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:44AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Thunderstorm producing heavy rainfall will impact portions of northwestern Franklin and northeastern St. Lawrence Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 242 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms over Lawrenceville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and very heavy rainfall of around 1/2 to 1 inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Potsdam, Massena, Canton, Norfolk, Moira, Bangor, Parishville, Fort Covington, Colton, Bombay, Massena International Airport - Richards Field, Helena, Brushton, Lawrenceville, Malone, Norwood, Brasher Falls, St. Regis, Burke, and Madrid. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence
